Components

Complex Buttons

Example Description Usage
Stateful

Markup:

<button data-loading-text="loading..." class="btn btn-primary stateful">Button</button>

Script:

$(…).button('loading');

Sets button state to loading—disables button and swaps text to loading text. Loading text should be defined on the button element using the data attribute data-loading-text.

NOTE: Firefox persists the disabled state across page loads. A workaround for this is to use autocomplete="off".

$(…).button('reset');

Resets button state—swaps text to original text.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-button
Toggle

Markup:

<button class="btn" data-toggle="button">Single Toggle</button>

Script:

$(…).button('toggle');

Toggles push state. Gives the button the appearance that it has been activated.

The data-toggle attribute enables auto-toggling.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-button
Radio Button Groups

Add data-toggle="buttons" for radio-style toggling on .btn-group.

<div class="btn-group" data-toggle="buttons">
  <label class="btn">
    <input type="radio" name="radio-group">Left
  </label>
  <label class="btn">
    <input type="radio" name="radio-group">Middle
  </label>
  <label class="btn">
    <input type="radio" name="radio-group">Right
  </label>
</div>
Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-button
Checkbox Button Groups

Add data-toggle="buttons" for checkbox-style toggling on .btn-group.

<div class="btn-group" data-toggle="buttons">
  <label class="btn">
    <input type="checkbox" name="checkbox-group">Left
  </label>
  <label class="btn">
    <input type="checkbox" name="checkbox-group">Middle
  </label>
  <label class="btn">
    <input type="checkbox" name="checkbox-group">Right
  </label>
</div>
Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-button

 Button Dropdowns

Use any button to trigger a dropdown menu by placing it within a .btn-group and providing the proper menu markup.

To quickly add dropdown functionality to any element just add data-toggle="dropdown" and any valid bootstrap dropdown will automatically be activated.

<div class="btn-group">
  <button class="btn dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown">Action <i class="icon-chevron-down"></i></button>
  <ul class="dropdown-menu">
    <li><a>Action</a></li>
    <li><a>Another action</a></li>
    <li><a>Something else here</a></li>
    <li class="divider"></li>
    <li><a>Separated link</a></li>
  </ul>
</div>

You may optionally target a specific dropdown by using data-target="#id" or href="#fat".

NOTE: In some cases—like mobile—dropdown menus will extend outside the viewport. You need to resolve the alignment manually or with custom javascript.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-dropdown
  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link
 Button Dropups

Add .dropup to a .btn-group containing a dropdown to switch to a dropup.

<div class="btn-group dropup">
  <button class="btn dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown">Action <i class="icon-chevron-up"></i></button>
  <ul class="dropdown-menu">
    <li><a>Action</a></li>
    <li><a>Another action</a></li>
    <li><a>Something else here</a></li>
    <li class="divider"></li>
    <li><a>Separated link</a></li>
  </ul>
</div>

NOTE: If using the original .caret markup from Bootstrap, the .caret will flip automatically for dropups. Otherwise, change the .dropdown-toggle icon to .icon-chevron-up.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-dropdown
  • Action

 Icon Buttons

An icon may be used in place of text for a button by adding .btn-icon to any Bootstrap button and including the proper Icon markup.

<button class="btn btn-primary btn-icon dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown"><i class="icon-user"></i> <i class="icon-chevron-down"></i></button>

NOTE: The icons prefixed .icon-chevron- are always rendered at 12px in .dropdown-toggle buttons.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-dropdown
    (for dropdown icon buttons only)
Asset 01
Asset 02
Asset 03
Asset 04
Asset 05
Asset 06
Filter Label Buttons

Add .btn-filter to a .btn-group to trigger special filter alignment rules.

<div class="btn-group btn-filter">
  <a class="btn">Asset 01</a>
  <a class="btn btn-remove"><i class="icon-remove"></i></a>
</div>

Icons with the prefix .color- specify colors for use within filter buttons. The primary GE Charting Palette is available for usage: cyan, green, orange, purple and red. 

<div class="btn-group btn-filter">
  <a class="btn"><i class="icon-star color-red"></i>Asset 01</a>
  <a class="btn btn-remove"><i class="icon-remove"></i></a>
</div>

Navigation

Masthead & Navigation Bar

Example

Open fullscreen example.

Description
Default Masthead & Primary Navigation.
Note: It is recommended that alerts, messages and user dropdowns should link to actual pages on mobile. As a result these dropdowns are disabled on small screens.
IIDX 2.0 Note: The bottom margin has been removed from the navbar in order to accomodate full screen types of layouts. In situations where a IIDX 1.0 developer was relying on this and using the "container", the developer should also add the "content" class to the same element. 
<div class="content container">my content....
Usage
<nav class="navbar navbar-static-top navbar-default" role="navigation">

  <div class="container">
    <!-- Brand and toggle get grouped for better mobile display -->
    <div class="navbar-header">
      <a class="navbar-brand" href="../index.html"><span class="ge-logo"></span> <span>IIDX - Basic UI Elements<small><i>powered by</i> Bootstrap</small></span></a>

      <!-- .navbar-toggle for collapsed navbar content -->
      <button type="button" class="navbar-toggle" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".nav-collapse">
        <span class="sr-only">Toggle navigation</span>
        <span class="icon-bar"></span>
        <span class="icon-bar"></span>
        <span class="icon-bar"></span>
      </button>
    </div>

    <div class="pull-right">
      <div class="btn-toolbar pull-left">
        <div class="btn-group">
          <button class="btn btn-danger dropdown-toggle" rel="tooltip" data-title="Alerts" data-placement="bottom" data-toggle="dropdown" data-original-title="" title=""><i class="icon-warning-sign"></i> 5</button>
          <ul class="dropdown-menu pull-right message-list">
            <li class="message-item">
              <a href="#">
                <span class="label label-important pull-left">Urgent</span>

              </a>
            </li>
            <li class="message-item">
              <a href="#">
                <span class="label label-warning pull-left">Moderate</span>
                <h4 class="message-title">Alert Type and Title</h4>
                <p>This is a brief description or summary of the associated event that occured…<br><time datetime="MM:DD:YYTHH:MM:SS" class="message-time">MM/DD/YY 12:05</time></p>
              </a>

                <li><a href="#">Alaba<strong>ma</strong></a></li>

Usage
<div class="container content">
  <div class="page-header">
        <h1 class="voice-brand pull-left">View Title</h1>
        <div class="secondary-nav pull-right">
            <ul class=" nav nav-pills pull-left" data-toggle="tab">
                <li class="active"><a href="#" data-toggle="tab">Secondary Nav 1</a></li>
                <li><a href="#" data-toggle="tab">Secondary Nav 2</a></li>
                <li><a href="#" data-toggle="tab">Secondary Nav 3</a></li>
                <li class="btn-group">
                    <a class="dropdown-toggle" href="#" data-toggle="dropdown">More <i class="icon-chevron-down"></i></a>
                    <ul class="dropdown-menu pull-right">
                        <li><a href="#" data-toggle="dropdown">Secondary Nav 4</a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" data-toggle="dropdown">Secondary Nav 5</a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" data-toggle="dropdown">Secondary Nav 6</a></li>
                    </ul>
                </li>
            </ul>         
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

Example

Open fullscreen example.

Description
Mega-Dropdown
Note: It is recommended that alerts, messages and user dropdowns should link to actual pages on mobile. As a result these dropdowns are disabled on small screens.
Usage

Markup:

<div class="navbar">
  <div class="masthead navbar-inner">
    …
  </div>
  <div class="primary-navbar navbar-inner collapse">
    <div class="container">
      <ul class="nav">
        <li><a href="#">Dashboard</a></li>
        <li class="active btn-group">
          <a class="dropdown-toggle" href="#" data-toggle="dropdown">Primary Nav 1</a>
          <ul class="dropdown-menu mega-dropdown">
            <li>
              <ul class="nav pull-left">
                <li class="nav-header"><a href="#">Secondary Nav 1</a></li>
                <li><a href="#">Tertiary Nav 1</a></li>
                <li><a href="#">Tertiary Nav 2</a></li>
                <li><a href="#">Tertiary Nav 3</a></li>
                <li><a href="#">Tertiary Nav 4</a></li>
                <li><a href="#">Tertiary Nav 5</a></li>
                <li><a href="#">Tertiary Nav 6</a></li>
                <li><a href="#">Tertiary Nav 7</a></li>
                <li><a href="#">Tertiary Nav 8</a></li>
              </ul>
            </li>
            …
          </ul>
        </li>
        …
      </ul>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

Script:

$('.mega-dropdown').each(
  function() {
    var $this = $( this );
    var $toggle = $this.prev('.dropdown-toggle');
    $this
      .css( { left: 0, width: ( $this.parents('.primary-navbar .container').width() ) } )
      .before( '' )
      .parent('.btn-group').css('position','static');
  }
)

NOTE: The script portion is required to force the .mega-dropdown to the full grid width.

To enable proper responsive behavior, include the following script to force the .mega-dropdown to single-column display at screen sizes less than 480 pixels:

$('.mega-dropdown').each(
  function() {
    $( this ).css( { left: 0, width: ( $( this ).parents('.primary-navbar .container').width() ) } );
  }
)
Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-dropdown
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-collapse
  • iids-navbar

Secondary Navigation

Example

Open fullscreen example.

Description
Secondary Navigation
A secondary, simple, text based navigation that would appear below a primary navigation
Usage
<div class="container">
    <ul class="secondarynav">
        <li class="active">Import from File</li>
        <li><a href="#">Import from URL</a></li>
        <li><a href="#">Create Single</a></li>
        <li><a href="#">Create Bulk</a></li>
    </ul>
</div>

Supplementary Navigation

Example Description Usage
  • Section 1
  • Section 2
  • Section 3
 Basic Tabs

Markup:

<ul class="nav nav-tabs">
  <li class="active"><a href="#tab1" data-toggle="tab">Section 1</a></li>
  <li><a href="#tab2" data-toggle="tab">Section 2</a></li>
  <li><a href="#tab3" data-toggle="tab">Section 3</a></li>
</ul>

Activate tab navigation without javascript by specifying data-toggle="tab" on an element. Adding the nav and nav-tabs classes to the tab ul will apply the bootstrap tab styling.

To align nav links, use the .pull-left or .pull-right utility classes. Both classes will add a CSS float in the specified direction.

Script:

$('#myTab a').click(function (e) {
  e.preventDefault();
  $(this).tab('show');
})
Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-tab
  • Section 1
  • Section 2
  • Section 3
 Stacked Tabs

Add .nav-stacked to the basic navigation markup.

<ul class="nav nav-tabs nav-stacked">
  <li class="active"><a href="#tab1" data-toggle="tab">Section 1</a></li>
  <li><a href="#tab2" data-toggle="tab">Section 2</a></li>
  <li><a href="#tab3" data-toggle="tab">Section 3</a></li>
</ul>
Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-tab
  • Section 1
  • Section 2
  • Dropdown
    • Action
    • Another action
    • Something else here
    • Separated link
 Tabs with Dropdowns 
<ul class="nav nav-tabs">
  <li class="active"><a href="#tab1">Section 1</a></li>
  <li><a href="#tab2">Section 2</a></li>
  <li class="dropdown">
    <a data-toggle="dropdown" >Dropdown <i class="icon-chevron-down"></i></a>
    <ul class="dropdown-menu">
      <li><a >Action</a></li>
      <li><a >Another action</a></li>
      <li><a >Something else here</a></li>
      <li class="divider"></li>
      <li><a >Separated link</a></li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

NOTE: Unlike simple tabs, tabs with dropdowns require javascript initialization.

NOTE: See Complex Buttons documentation for more information on dropdown requirements.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-tab
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-dropdown

 Tabbables 
<div class="tabbable">
  <ul class="nav nav-tabs">
    <li class="active"><a href="#tab1" data-toggle="tab">Section 1</a></li>
    <li><a href="#tab2" data-toggle="tab">Section 2</a></li>
    <li><a href="#tab3" data-toggle="tab">Section 3</a></li>
  </ul>
  <div class="tab-content">
    <div class="tab-pane active" id="tab1">
      <p>Section 1</p>
    </div>
    …
  </div>
</div>

To make tabs fade in, add .fade to each .tab-pane.

Variant positions can be implemented by adding .tabs-left, .tabs-right or .tabs-below to .tabbable.

For .tabs-below, .tab-content and .nav-tabs need to be in reverse order.

<div class="tabbable tabs-below">
  <div class="tab-content">
    …
  </div>
  <ul class="nav nav-tabs">
    …
  </ul>
</div>
Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-tab
  • Page 1
  • Page 2
  • Page 3
 Basic Pills

Markup:

<ul class="nav nav-pills">
  <li class="active"><a >Page 1</a></li>
  <li><a >Page 2</a></li>
  <li><a >Page 3</a></li>
</ul>

To align nav links, use the .pull-left or .pull-right utility classes. Both classes will add a CSS float in the specified direction.

  <li class="nav-header">List header</li>
  <li class="active"><a ><i class="icon-white icon-home"></i>Home</a></li>

</ul>

Pager

Centered:

<ul class="pager">
  <li><a >Previous</a></li>
  <li><a >Next</a></li>
</ul>

Left/Right Aligned:

<ul class="pager">
  <li class="previous disabled"><a ><i class="icon-arrow-left"></i> Older</a></li>
  <li class="next"><a >Newer <i class="icon-arrow-right"></i></a></li>
</ul>

 Collapsible List 
<ul class="collapsible-list">
  <li class="nav-header">List Header</li>
  <li class="collapsible-list-subnav">
    <a class="collapsible-list-parent" >Primary Nav 1</a>
    <ul class="collapsible-list secondary">
      <li class="collapsible-list-subnav">
        <a class="collapsible-list-parent" >Secondary Nav 1</a>
        <ul class="collapsible-list tertiary">
          <li>
             <a >Tertiary Nav 1</a>
          </li>
        </ul>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </li>
  <li class="collapsible-list-subnav">
    <a class="collapsible-list-parent" >Primary Nav 2</a>
    <ul class="collapsible-list secondary">
      <li>
        <a >Secondary Nav 2</a>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </li>
  <li><a >Primary Nav 3</a></li>
  <li class="nav-header">Another List Header</li>
  <li><a >Primary Nav 4</a></li>
  <li><a >Primary Nav 5</a></li>
</ul>

Expand/collapse functionality for List Navigation; limited by design to three levels of navigation. When a significant amount of information is available within a list, and individual items can be grouped under clear headings, it may be preferable to make the groups collapsible in order to save screen real estate and reduce cognitive load.

Add class="collapsible-list" to the toplevel ul.

Options:

Name Description
collapsible-list-parent add to your anchor tags that have children
nav-header unselectable li item
secondary add to ul to create 2nd level items
tertiary add to ul to create 3rd level items
collapsible-list-subnav add to li to create collapsible item
Script Requirement:
  • collapsible-list.js
Right click in this box
 Context Menu

Add the contextmenu class to your DOM element.

<div class="contextmenu">Right click in this box</div>

Then add your data elements to your project's JavaScript:

$.contextMenu({
  // define which elements trigger this menu
  selector: ".contextmenu",
  // define the elements of the menu
  items: {
    "action1": {"name": "Action"},
    "action2": {"name": "Another action"},
    "action3": {"name": "Something else here"},
    "sep1": "---------",
    "fold1": {
        "name": "Separated link",
        "items": {
            "fold1-key1": {"name": "Action"},
            "fold1-key3": {"name": "Another Action"}
        }
    }
  },
  // handle click actions on your items defined above
  callback: function(key, options) {
    ...
  }
});

NOTE: contextmenu does not work on mobile.

Script Requirements:
  • jQuery-contextMenu/src/jquery.contextMenu.js
  • contextmenu.js

Multi-Step-Navigation

Example
  • Step 1: Lorem ipsum dolor
  • Step 2: Sit amet adipiscing
  • Step 3: Consecteur etud
  • Previous
  • Next
  • Finish
Multi-Step-Navigation is a wizard-style progress pattern based off the twitter-bootstrap-wizard plugin. Full documentation available here 
          <div class="col-sm-8 col-md-8 multi-step-nav">
              <div class="navbar">
                <div class="navbar-inner">
                  <div class="container" style="margin: 20px;">
                    <ul>
                      <li><a href="#tab1" data-toggle="tab"><i class="icon-circle-blank"></i> Step 1: Lorem ipsum dolor</a></li>
                      <li><a href="#tab2" data-toggle="tab"><i class="icon-circle-blank"></i> Step 2: Sit amet adipiscing</a></li>
                      <li><a href="#tab3" data-toggle="tab"><i class="icon-circle-blank"></i> Step 3: Consecteur etud</a></li>
                    </ul>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
              <div class="tab-content">
                <ul class="pager wizard">
                  <li class="previous"><a href="#">Previous</a></li>
                  <li class="next"><a href="#">Next</a></li>
                  <li class="next finish" style="display:none;"><a href="javascript:;">Finish</a></li>
                </ul>
              </div>
            </div>
Script Requirements:
  • multi-step-navigation/js/multi-step-navigation

Description
Jump Navigation
A navigation that docks at the top of the screen in the context of scrolling, but looks like a normal static navigation when at the top of the page
Usage
    <div class="jumpnav">

            <li><a href="#conclusion">Conclusion</a></li>
        </ul>
    </div>

        <div class="jumpcontent">

Quis autem vel eum iure reprehenderit qui in ea voluptate velit esse quam nihil molestiae consequatur, vel illum qui dolorem eum fugiat quo voluptas nulla pariatur?</p>
            </div>

Labels, Badges & Alerts

Example Description Usage
Default
Success
Warning
Important
Info
Inverse
Labels 
<span class="label">Default</span>

Add one of .label-success, .label-warning, .label-important, .label-info or .label-inverse to colorize the .label for the appropriate context.

<span class="label label-success">Success</span>

Use the Bootstrap utility classes .pull-left or .pull-right to make .label float alongside headlines or other block elements.

1

2

4

6

8

10

Badges 
<span class="badge">1</span>

Add one of .badge-success, .badge-warning, .badge-important, .badge-info or .badge-inverse to colorize the .badge for the appropriate context.

<span class="badge badge-success">2</span>
Warning! Best check yo self.
Oh snap! Change a few things up.
Well done! You successfully read this.
Heads up! This needs your attention.

Warning!

Best check yo self, you're not looking too good. Nulla vitae elit libero, a pharetra augue. Praesent commodo cursus magna, vel scelerisque nisl consectetur et.

Oh Snap!

Change a few things and try submitting again. Change this and that and try again. Duis mollis, est non commodo luctus, nisi erat porttitor ligula, eget lacinia odio sem nec elit. Cras mattis consectetur purus sit amet fermentum.

 Alerts 
<div class="alert">
  <strong>Warning!</strong> Best check yo self.
</div>

Use one of .alert-success, .alert-info or .alert-error to colorize the .alert for the appropriate context.

<div class="alert alert-success">
  <strong>Well done!</strong> You successfully read this.
</div>

Add .alert-fixed-top to .alert to fix the position to the top of the browser window and only round the bottom corners.

Add an optional button before the message. Use the attribute data-dismiss="alert" to automatically enable alert dismissal.

Markup:

<div class="alert alert-error">
  <button type="button" class="close" data-dismiss="alert">×</button>
  <strong>Oh snap!</strong> Change a few things up.
</div>

Script:

$(…).alert('close');
Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-alert

Tooltips, Popovers & Modals

Example Description Usage

Pants level kale you probably haven't heard of them. Fixie sustainable quinoa 8-bit american apparel have a terry richardson vinyl chambray. A really ironic artisan whatever keytar, scenester farm-to-table Austin twitter handle freegan cred raw denim single-origin coffee viral.

 Tooltips

Markup:

Lorem ipsum <a class="tooltip-target" title="tooltip text">dolor sit</a> amet.

Script:

$(…).tooltip(options);

Options:

Name Type Default Description
animation boolean true apply a css fade transition to the tooltip
html boolean false Insert html into the tooltip. If false, jquery's text method will be used to insert content into the dom. Use text if you're worried about XSS attacks.
placement string|function 'top' how to position the tooltip - top | bottom | left | right
selector string false If a selector is provided, tooltip objects will be delegated to the specified targets.
title string | function '' default title value if `title` tag isn't present
trigger string 'hover focus' how tooltip is triggered - click | hover | focus | manual. Note you case pass trigger mutliple, space seperated, trigger types.
delay number | object 0

delay showing and hiding the tooltip (ms) - does not apply to manual trigger type

If a number is supplied, delay is applied to both hide/show

Object structure is: delay: { show: 500, hide: 100 }
container string | false false Appends the tooltip to a specific element container: 'body'

All of the above options may be applied independently as data- attributes.

NOTE: For performance reasons, tooltips are opt-in. They must be manually initialized to function.

NOTE: iids.js disables tooltips on mobile. It is recommended that you follow this practice since most mobile devices do not support hover events well.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-tooltip
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-transition
click for popover
Popovers

Markup:

<a class="btn popover-target" href="#" data-content="popover content" data-original-title="popover title">Button</a>

Script:

$(…).popover(options);

Options:

Name Type Default Description
animation boolean true apply a css fade transition to the tooltip
html boolean false Insert html into the popover. If false, jquery's text method will be used to insert content into the dom. Use text if you're worried about XSS attacks.
placement string|function 'right' how to position the popover - top | bottom | left | right
selector string false if a selector is provided, tooltip objects will be delegated to the specified targets
trigger string 'click' how popover is triggered - click | hover | focus | manual
title string | function '' default title value if `title` attribute isn't present
content string | function '' default content value if `data-content` attribute isn't present
delay number | object 0

delay showing and hiding the popover (ms) - does not apply to manual trigger type

If a number is supplied, delay is applied to both hide/show

Object structure is: delay: { show: 500, hide: 100 }
container string | false false Appends the popover to a specific element container: 'body'

All of the above options may be applied independently as data- attributes.

NOTE: For performance reasons, popovers are opt-in. They must be manually initialized to function.

NOTE: iids.js includes additional code snippets to allow easy dismissal of popovers and to prevent default click behaviors.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-popover
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-transition
click for popover 1

Here's some engaging content. It's very engaging, right?

Lorem ipsum dolor set amet lorem ipsum dolor

click for popover 2
  • FKY
    PORTLAND, OR
  • .98

-18.2mw
Ideal MW Output: 3947

Tom Smith Site Manager

 Rich Popovers

Markup:

<a id="popover1" class="btn btn-danger rich-popover-target">click for popover 1</a>

<div id="popover1-content-wrapper" style="display: none">
  <p><button class="btn btn-small btn-success">success</button> Here's some engaging content. It's very engaging, right?</p>
  <div class="divider"></div>
  <p><strong>Lorem ipsum dolor set amet lorem ipsum dolor</strong></p>
</div>

<a id="popover2" class="btn btn-danger rich-popover-target">click for popover 2</a>

<div id="popover2-content-wrapper" style="display: none">
  <div class="rich-title rich-title-success">
    <ul class="inline">
      <li class="vertical-divider">FKY<br/>PORTLAND, OR</li>
      <li>.98</li>
    </ul>
  </div>
  <p><strong>-18.2</strong>mw<br/>
  Ideal MW Output: 3947</p>
  <div class="divider"></div>
  <p><i class="icon-user"></i> <strong>Tom Smith</strong> Site Manager</p>
</div>

Script:

$('#popover1').popover({
  html: true,
  title: 'A Title',
  content: function() {
    return $('#popover1-content-wrapper').html();
  }
}).on('click', function(e) {
  e.preventDefault();
});

$('#popover2').popover({
  html: true,
  placement: 'top',
  content: function() {
    return $('#popover2-content-wrapper').html();
  }
}).on('click', function(e) {
  e.preventDefault();
});

Options:

Name Type Default Description
animation boolean true apply a css fade transition to the tooltip
html boolean false Insert html into the popover. If false, jquery's text method will be used to insert content into the dom. Use text if you're worried about XSS attacks.
placement string|function 'right' how to position the popover - top | bottom | left | right
selector string false if a selector is provided, tooltip objects will be delegated to the specified targets
trigger string 'click' how popover is triggered - click | hover | focus | manual
title string | function '' default title value if `title` attribute isn't present
content string | function '' default content value if `data-content` attribute isn't present
delay number | object 0

delay showing and hiding the popover (ms) - does not apply to manual trigger type

If a number is supplied, delay is applied to both hide/show

Object structure is: delay: { show: 500, hide: 100 }
container string | false false Appends the popover to a specific element container: 'body'

All of the above options may be applied independently as data- attributes.

NOTE: For performance reasons, popovers are opt-in. They must be manually initialized to function.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-popover
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-transition

We set a fixed max-height on the .modal-body. Watch it overflow with all this extra lorem ipsum text we've included.

Cras mattis consectetur purus sit amet fermentum. Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam. Morbi leo risus, porta ac consectetur ac, vestibulum at eros.

Close Save changes
Modals

To activate modals, set data-toggle="modal" on a controller element with a data-target="#foo" or href="#foo" which corresponds to a modal element id, and when clicked, it will launch your modal.

Options may be added to the modal via script or as data- attributes on either the modal or the control element.

To enable fade-in/-out transitions on a modal, include .fade on the .modal element.

Markup:



<div id="modal-demo" class="modal fade in" aria-hidden="true" >
          <div class="modal-dialog">
            <div class="modal-content">
              <div class="modal-header">
                <button type="button" class="close" data-dismiss="modal">×</button>
                <h3 class="modal-title">Modal Heading</h3>
              </div>
              <div class="modal-body">
                <h4>Text in a modal</h4>
                <p>Duis mollis, est non commodo luctus, nisi erat porttitor ligula, eget lacinia odio sem.</p>
                <h4>Popover in a modal</h4>
                <p>This <a class="btn popover-target" data-content="And here's some amazing content. It's very engaging. right?" data-original-title="A Title">button</a> should trigger a popover on hover.</p>
                <h4>Tooltips in a modal</h4>
                <p><a class="tooltip-target" data-original-title="Tooltip">This link</a> and <a class="tooltip-test" data-original-title="Tooltip">that link</a> should have tooltips on hover.</p>
                <hr>
                <h4>Overflowing text to show optional scrollbar</h4>
                <p>We set a fixed <code>max-height</code> on the <code>.modal-body</code>. Watch it overflow with all this extra lorem ipsum text we've included.</p>
                <p>Cras mattis consectetur purus sit amet fermentum. Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam. Morbi leo risus, porta ac consectetur ac, vestibulum at eros.</p>
                <p>Praesent commodo cursus magna, vel scelerisque nisl consectetur et. Vivamus sagittis lacus vel augue laoreet rutrum faucibus dolor auctor.</p>
                <p>Aenean lacinia bibendum nulla sed consectetur. Praesent commodo cursus magna, vel scelerisque nisl consectetur et. Donec sed odio dui. Donec ullamcorper nulla non metus auctor fringilla.</p>
                <p>Cras mattis consectetur purus sit amet fermentum. Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam. Morbi leo risus, porta ac consectetur ac, vestibulum at eros.</p>
                <p>Praesent commodo cursus magna, vel scelerisque nisl consectetur et. Vivamus sagittis lacus vel augue laoreet rutrum faucibus dolor auctor.</p>
                <p>Aenean lacinia bibendum nulla sed consectetur. Praesent commodo cursus magna, vel scelerisque nisl consectetur et. Donec sed odio dui. Donec ullamcorper nulla non metus auctor fringilla.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="modal-footer">
                <a class="btn" data-dismiss="modal">Close</a>
                <a class="btn btn-primary">Save changes</a>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

<button data-toggle="modal" data-target="#modal-demo" class="btn btn-primary btn-large">Launch Modal</button>

Options:

Name Type Default Description
backdrop boolean true Includes a modal-backdrop element. Alternatively, specify static for a backdrop which doesn't close the modal on click.
keyboard boolean true Closes the modal when escape key is pressed
show boolean true Shows the modal when initialized.
remote path false If a remote url is provided, content will be loaded via jQuery's load method and injected into the .modal-body. If you're using the data api, you may alternatively use the href tag to specify the remote source. An example of this is shown below: 
<a data-toggle="modal" href="remote.html" data-target="#modal">click me</a>

NOTE: See Bootstrap documentation for a full list of options and events for modals.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-modal
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-transition

Lists & Accordions

 Inspector List (Accordion) 
<div class="accordion" id="accordion">
    <div class="panel-group" id="accordion">
        <div class="panel panel-default">
            <div class="panel-heading">
                <a class="panel-toggle collapsed" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="#accordion" href="#collapseOne"><i class="icon-ico_chevron_right_lg"></i>Collapsible Group Item #1</a>
            </div>
            <div id="collapseOne" class="panel-collapse collapse">
                <div class="panel-body">collapse content goes here</div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

Just add data-toggle="collapse" and a data-target to element to automatically assign control of a collapsible element. The data-target attribute accepts a css selector to apply the collapse to. Be sure to add the class collapse to the collapsible element and collapsed to the header link. If you'd like it to default open, add the additional class in to the collapse body, and remove collapsed from the header.

NOTE: See Bootstrap documentation for a full list of options, methods and events for controlling collapsibles.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-collapse
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-transition

Content Display

Example Description Usage
Thumbnail label

Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam.

Thumbnail label

Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam.

Action Action

 Thumbnails

Simple thumbnail:

<a class="thumbnail">
  <img src="http://placehold.it/300x200" alt="">
</a>

Thumbnails may col-sm-3 col-md-3 as much additional HTML as needed. Use .caption as a wrapper for additional markup.

<div class="thumbnail">
  <img src="http://placehold.it/300x200" alt="">
  <div class="caption">
    <h5>Thumbnail label</h5>
    <p>Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam.</p>
    <p><a class="btn">Action</a></p>
  </div>
</div>
Thumbnail Grid

The thumbnails component uses existing grid system classes—like .span2 or .col-sm-3 col-md-3—for control of thumbnail dimensions.

<ul class="thumbnails">
  <li class="span2">
    <a class="thumbnail">
      <img src="http://placehold.it/140x100" alt="">
    </a>
  </li>
  …
</ul>

First Thumbnail label

Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam.

Second Thumbnail label

Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam.

Third Thumbnail label

Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam.

 Carousel

Markup:

<div id="myCarousel" class="carousel slide">
  <div class="carousel-inner">
    <div class="item">
      <img src="http://placehold.it/400x300" alt="">
      <div class="carousel-caption">
        <h4>First Thumbnail label</h4>
        <p>Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam. Donec id elit non mi porta gravida at eget metus. Nullam id dolor id nibh ultricies vehicula ut id elit.</p>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="item active">
      <img src="http://placehold.it/400x300" alt="">
      <div class="carousel-caption">
        <h4>Second Thumbnail label</h4>
        <p>Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam. Donec id elit non mi porta gravida at eget metus. Nullam id dolor id nibh ultricies vehicula ut id elit.</p>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="item">
      <img src="http://placehold.it/400x300" alt="">
      <div class="carousel-caption">
        <h4>Third Thumbnail label</h4>
        <p>Cras justo odio, dapibus ac facilisis in, egestas eget quam. Donec id elit non mi porta gravida at eget metus. Nullam id dolor id nibh ultricies vehicula ut id elit.</p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  <a class="left carousel-control" href="#myCarousel" data-slide="prev"><i class="icon-arrow-left"></i></a>
  <a class="right carousel-control" href="#myCarousel" data-slide="next"><i class="icon-arrow-right"></i></a>
</div>

Script:

$(…).carousel(options);

Options:

Name Type Default Description
interval number 5000 The amount of time to delay between automatically cycling an item. If false, carousel will not automatically cycle.
pause string "hover" Pauses the cycling of the carousel on mouseenter and resumes the cycling of the carousel on mouseleave.

NOTE: See Bootstrap documentation for a full list of options and events for carousels.

Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-carousel
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-transition

Loading Indicators

Example Description Usage
Progress Bar (Basic) 
<div class="progress">
  <div class="bar" style="width: 45%;"></div>
</div>

Use a percentage width on .bar to advance progress bars.

Add one of .progress-success, .progress-info, .progress-warning or .progress-danger to colorize .bar according to context.

<div class="progress progress-success">
  <div class="bar" style="width: 45%;"></div>
</div>
Progress Bar (Striped)

Add .progress-striped to add a striping effect to the progress bar.

<div class="progress progress-striped">
  <div class="bar" style="width: 45%;"></div>
</div>
Progress Bar (Animated)

Add .active to a striped progress bar to trigger animation.

<div class="progress progress-striped active">
  <div class="bar" style="width: 45%;"></div>
</div>
Activity Indicator (Spinner)

Markup:

<div id="spinner"></div>

Script:

// start spinning
$(…).spin();

// stop spinning
$(…).spin(false);

The size and color of the spinner can be modified by passing options when initializing.

NOTE: The options listed in the example are default.

var options = {
  // The number of lines to draw
  lines: 10,
  // The length of each line
  length: 4,
  // The line thickness 
  width: 2,
  // The radius of the inner circle
  radius: 4, 
  // The rotation offset
  rotate: 0, 
  // #rgb or #rrggbb
  color: '#313337',
  // Rounds per second
  speed: 1.2,
  // Afterglow percentage 
  trail: 60, 
  // Whether to render a shadow
  shadow: false, 
  // Whether to use hardware acceleration
  hwaccel: false, 
  // The CSS class to assign to the spinner
  className: 'spinner', 
  // The z-index (defaults to 2000000000)
  zIndex: 2e9, 
  // Top position relative to parent in px
  top: 'auto', 
  // Left position relative to parent in px
  left: 'auto' 
};
$(…).spin(options);

NOTE: See spin.js documentation for a full list of configuration options.

Script Requirements:
  • spinner

Search Utilities

Example Description Usage
Typeahead

Markup:

            <div class="input-append input-group">
              <input type="text" class="form-control " id="typeahead-example">
              <span class="input-group-btn">
                <button class="btn add-on" type="button">
                  <i class="icon-search"></i>
                </button>
              </span>
            </div>

Script:

         var states = new Bloodhound({
              datumTokenizer: function(d) {
                  return Bloodhound.tokenizers.whitespace(d.val);
              },
              queryTokenizer: Bloodhound.tokenizers.whitespace,
              local: [{ val: 'Alabama' }, { val: 'Alaska' }...... ]
            });

          states.initialize();

          $('#typeahead-example').typeahead({
                highlight: true
            },
            {
                displayKey: 'val',
                source: states.ttAdapter()
            });

NOTE: See Bootstrap Typeahead Examples for a full list of options.

XYZ20000093.98 93.907.6364
Portrero Hill 30000097.0697.04 0.4776
Portrero Hill 35000095.0195.172.16 75
Nob Hill 40000094.1894.401.08 70
Pacific Heights 60000094.0193.454.87 70
Description

Basic Data Grid. Implemented as the iidsBasicDataGrid jQuery plugin, which uses the DataTables.net jQuery plugin in its implementation.

There's More! For a comprehensive overview of Datagrids see the Datagrids data loading and settings and plugins example pages.
Usage

Markup:

<input type="text" id="table_filter" class="form-control search-query pull-right" data-filter-table="my-table">
<!-- initially hidden to avoid flash of unstyled content -->
<table class="table table-bordered" data-table-name="my-table" style="visibility: hidden">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>Site Name</th>
      <th class="numeric">Turbine SN</th>
      <th class="numeric">Average</th>
      <th class="numeric">Median</th>
      <th class="numeric">Standard Deviation</th>
      <!-- headers with the class="visualization-bar" will display as graphical bar charts -->
      <th class="visualization-bar">Percentile</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td><a href="#">XYZ</a></td>
      <td>100000</td><td>95.79</td><td>96.70</td><td>4.79</td>
      <td>60</td>
    </tr>
    ... (additional rows) ...
  </tbody>
</table>

Script:

require( ['jquery', 'datagrids'], function($) {
  $(function() {
    $('table[data-table-name="my-table"]').iidsBasicDataGrid();
    // avoid flash of unstyled content
    $('table[data-table-name="my-table"]').css( { visibility: 'visible' } );
  });
});

Notes:

  • Any <input> elements with an attribute data-filter-table="<table-name>" (where <table-name> is the data-table-name of an IIDS data table) will become filters using the standard datatables.net fnFilter() capability.
  • Links are supported transparently, by adding <a href="...">link</a> to the content of a cell.
  • Add class="outlier" to <td> elements to mark a cell as an outlier.
  • DataTables does not natively support click events on rows. We've added this functionality so when you click on a row it now adds the class .row_selected, highlights and dispatches the event selected. The selected event contains two attributes: the row that was selected and a collection of all selected rows in the table.

See DataTables.net for more information.

Script Requirements:
  • datatables

Bootstrap Time Picker

Example
Description
Bootstrap Timepicker
Usage

We've added a thin layer around bootstrap-timepicker

<div class="col-md-2 input-group timepicker">
  <input type="text" class="timepicker form-control">
  <span class="input-group-btn">
    <button class="btn add-on" type="button"><i class="icon-time"></i></button>
  </span>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    require.config({
    baseUrl: '../src'
  });

  require([
    'jquery',
    'timepicker'
  ], function ($) {
    $('.timepicker').timepicker();
  });
</script>
Script Requirements:
  • bootstap-timepicker, bootstrap, jquery, require, timepicker

Filter Controls

Example
  • Items
  • Item 1
  • Item 2
Filter 001
Description

A Filter Tray contains the IIDS Rule Builder, primarily used for filtering and highlighting tables. It is initially hidden. Bootstrap's collapse functionality is used to hide and show the tray.

The IIDS provides a Filter Button to hide and show the tray. The Filter Button is a split button with a dropdown. Buttons for filter presets can stack alongside the filter button.
Note: Presently there is no responsive solution for filter trays so it is recommended they be hidden on mobile.

Usage

Markup:

<div class="tray collapse">
  <div class="tray-inner">
    <div class="filter-tray clearfix">
      <div class="group-filter-rules">
      </div>

      
      <script type="text/template" id="filter-rule-template">
      <div class="filter-rule col-sm-9 col-md-9 offset2">

      <select class="col-sm-2 col-md-2">
      <option value="show">Show Only</option>
      <option value="hide">Hide</option>
      <option value="highlight">Highlight</option>
      </select>

      <select class="col-sm-2 col-md-2">
      <option value="siteName">Site Name</option>
      <option value="turbineSN">Turbine SN</option>
      <option value="average">Average</option>
      <option value="median">Median</option>
      <option value="standardDeviation">Standard Deviation</option>
      <option value="percentile">Percentile</option>
      </select>

      <select class="col-sm-1 col-md-1">
      <option value="=">=</option>
      <option value=">">></option>
      <option value=">=">>=</option>
      <option value="<"><</option>
      <option value="<="><=</option>
      <option value="startsWidth">starts with</option>
      <option value="endsWith">ends width</option>
      <option value="contains">contains</option>
      <option value="doesNotContain">does not contain</option>
      </select>

      <input type="text" value="sample" class="col-sm-3 col-md-3"></input>

      <a class="remove-filter-rule"><i class="icon-remove-sign"></i></a>
      </div>
      </script>
      
      <div class="filter-actions col-lg-offset-2 col-sm-8 col-md-8 offset2">
        <a href="#add-filter-rule" class=" col-sm-2 col-md-2 add-filter-rule"><i class="icon-plus-sign"></i> Add Condition</a>
        <div class="action-button-group col-sm-6 col-md-6">
          <button class="btn btn-default">Cancel</button>
          <button class="btn btn-primary">Apply</button>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  <div class="arrow"></div>
</div>

<div class="filter-controls">
  <div class="btn-group">
    <button class="btn btn-primary tray-toggle" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".tray">Filter</button>
    <button class="btn btn-primary dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown"><span class="caret"></span></button>
    <ul class="dropdown-menu">
      <li><a href="#"><strong>Items</strong></a></li>
      <li><a href="#">Item 1</a></li>
      <li><a href="#">Item 2</a></li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</div>
<div class="btn-group btn-filter">
  <a href="#" class="btn"><i class="icon-star color-danger"></i> Filter 001</a>
  <a href="#" class="btn btn-remove"><i class="icon-remove"></i></a>
</div>

Script:

require( ['trays'], function() {
  $('.tray').iidsFilterTray();
});
Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-collapse
Example, filter-tray + datagrid
  • Items
  • Item 1
  • Item 2
Filter 001
Description

In the example, we have a data grid combined with a filter-tray component. The ideal, is we can qualify a search query url with our rule-builder. With the modified search query string, we can alter the search SQL server side, by utilizing the datagirds ajax functionality.

Usage

Markup:

<div id="tray-datagrid" class="tray collapse">
  <div class="tray-inner">
    <div class="filter-tray clearfix">
      <div class="group-filter-rules">
      </div>

      
      <script type="text/template" id="filter-rule-template">
      <div class="filter-rule col-md-9 offset2">

      <select class="col-md-2">
      <option value="show">Show Only</option>
      <option value="hide">Hide</option>
      <option value="highlight">Highlight</option>
      </select>

      <select class="col-md-2">
      <option value="siteName">Site Name</option>
      <option value="turbineSN">Turbine SN</option>
      <option value="average">Average</option>
      <option value="median">Median</option>
      <option value="standardDeviation">Standard Deviation</option>
      <option value="percentile">Percentile</option>
      </select>

      <select class="col-md-1">
      <option value="=">=</option>
      <option value=">">></option>
      <option value=">=">>=</option>
      <option value="<"><</option>
      <option value="<="><=</option>
      <option value="startsWidth">starts with</option>
      <option value="endsWith">ends width</option>
      <option value="contains">contains</option>
      <option value="doesNotContain">does not contain</option>
      </select>

      <input type="text" value="sample" class="col-md-3"></input>

      <a class="remove-filter-rule"><i class="icon-remove-sign"></i></a>
      </div>
      </script>
      
      <div class="filter-actions col-md-8 offset2">
        <a href="#add-filter-rule" class="col-md-2 add-filter-rule"><i class="icon-plus-sign"></i> Add Condition</a>
        <div class="action-button-group col-md-6">
          <button class="btn">Cancel</button>
          <button class="btn btn-primary">Apply</button>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  <div class="arrow"></div>
</div>

<div class="filter-controls">
  <div class="btn-group">
    <button class="btn btn-primary tray-toggle" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#tray-datagrid">Filter</button>
    <button class="btn btn-primary dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown"><span class="caret"></span></button>
    <ul class="dropdown-menu">
      <li><a href="#"><strong>Items</strong></a></li>
      <li><a href="#">Item 1</a></li>
      <li><a href="#">Item 2</a></li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</div>
<div class="btn-group btn-filter">
  <a href="#" class="btn"><i class="icon-star color-danger"></i> Filter 001</a>
  <a href="#" class="btn btn-remove"><i class="icon-remove"></i></a>
</div>

Script:

<script type="text/javascript" charset="utf-8">

  var oTable;
  require([
        'jquery',
        'trays',
        'datagrids'
    ], function($){
        init();
  } );

  function init()
  {
    initTrays();
    initDatagrid();
  }


  function initTrays()
  {
    $('#tray-datagrid').iidsFilterTray();
    $('#tray-datagrid .control .cancel').click(function(e){
      e.preventDefault();
    });

    $('#tray-datagrid .control .apply').click(function(e){
      e.preventDefault();

      $('#tray-datagrid .filter-rule').each(function(item, i ){
        var results = parseFilterItem(item);
        /**
         * NOTE: we could transform the data to json,
         * OR use the data to create a query string
         * THEN, reload the data by invoking the oTable.fnReloadAjax call
         */
         var newUrl = '../data/spoof-data-1.json';
        //var json = $.toJSON(results);
          newUrl += "?key=value&key2=value2&ext";
        //initDatagrid();

         var instance = $('table[data-table-name="dt-array-results"]').data('iidsBasicDataGrid');
             instance.reloadAjax(instance.$table.fnSettings(), newUrl, null, null);
      });

      function parseFilterItem(item)
      {
        var results = [];
        var row = {};
        var elm = $(item).find("option");

/*
            insert logic here. add data to the row object, which will be returned in a resutls array
*/
            results.push(row);
            return results;
      }

    });

  }

  function initDatagrid()
  {
    // JavaScript array and columns
    oTable = $('table[data-table-name="dt-array-results"]').iidsBasicDataGrid({
    'aoColumns': [
        { 'sTitle': 'Rendering engine', 'mData': 'engine', 'sClass': 'essential' },
        { 'sTitle': 'Browser', 'mData': 'browser', 'sClass': 'essential' },
        { 'sTitle': 'Platform(s)', 'mData': 'platform', 'sClass': 'optional' },
        { 'sTitle': 'Engine version', 'mData': 'version' },
        { 'sTitle': 'CSS grade', 'mData': 'grade', 'sClass': 'essential' }
    ],
      'sAjaxSource': '../data/spoof-data-0.json',
      'isResponsive': true
      });


  }






</script>
Script Requirements:
  • bootstrap/bootstrap-collapse
